No Person whatsoever shall kill any Cattle, Horse, Mare, Mule, or Assinego, under the Penalty of 15 l. to be recovered in any Court of Record, by the Owner or Proprietor of the said Beast.

All Owners of Neat Cattle shall keep one white Man at each Pen, and two white Men at every Pen, whereunto belongs above 200 Head of Cattle, Penalty 10 l. for every white Man wanting for the Space of three Months, Half to the Poor of the Parish, Half to the Informer.

All Owners of Cattle shall pen them once in three Nights at least, or pay the Damage double which such Cattle shall do.

Strays shall belong to the Proprietor of the Ground where taken up, provided he cries the Stray three Court Days with proper Descriptions, and turns the same loose in the feeding Grounds, with a Withe about the Neck for an Year; and if not claimed in that Time, the Property shall be his. Ear mark'd, or burnt mark'd Cattle shall belong to the right Owners, if claim'd any Time after the Expiration of the Year.
